title: BunionAdvertorialContent
description: JSON schema for bunion corrector advertorial template. This template features a modern editorial design with author byline, verified badges, review sections, rating breakdowns, and social proof elements. Best for health remedies, medical devices, and pain relief products.

label.description: Topbar announcement text. Example: 'Limited Time: Free Shipping + 50% Off' or 'As Featured On NBC, ABC, FOX'. Keep under 60 characters.

icon.description: URL to info icon image (small icon, 16x16px recommended).

text.description: Info text. Usually 'Advertorial' or 'Sponsored Content'. Keep it simple.

banner.description: Update banner text. Newsworthy announcement. Example: 'As of December 2024, [Product] is now available nationwide with free shipping' or 'Stock Alert: Due to high demand, orders may be delayed'. 60-150 characters. Create urgency without overselling.

text.description: Breadcrumb navigation. Example: 'Home > Health > Foot Care > Reviews' or 'Articles > Pain Relief > Bunion Solutions'. Use ' > ' separator.

hero.description: Hero section with headline and subheadline

headline.description: Main article headline. Should be editorial and newsworthy. Examples: 'Doctors Reveal: This Simple Device May Finally Relieve Bunion Pain' or 'New Solution For Bunions Gaining Popularity Among Podiatrists'. Use authority words like 'Doctors', 'Experts', 'Scientists'. 60-120 characters.

subheadline.description: Supporting subheadline. Adds context or amplifies main claim. Example: 'Non-surgical approach gaining traction as thousands report relief' or 'FDA-registered device shows promise in clinical observations'. 50-120 characters.

url.description: URL to jump to reviews section (typically '#reviews').

ratingImage.description: URL to star rating image. Show average rating (e.g., 4.8 stars image).

ratingText.description: Alt text for rating. Example: '4.8 out of 5 stars' or '4.9 stars based on 3,791 reviews'.

image.description: URL to author profile image. Should be professional headshot, 80x80px or larger.

name.description: Author name. Use realistic name with credentials if applicable. Example: 'Dr. Sarah Mitchell' or 'James Rodriguez, Health Editor'. 10-50 characters.

date.description: Publication date. Example: 'Published December 15, 2024' or 'Updated January 2025'. Use format: 'Month Day, Year'.

verifiedIcon.description: URL to verified checkmark icon (16x16px recommended).

intro.description: Opening story paragraph. Sets context and hooks reader. Should feel editorial, not salesy. Example: 'For years, people suffering from bunions had limited options: endure the pain, wear uncomfortable shoes, or undergo expensive surgery. But recent developments in non-invasive foot care may be changing that...' 150-400 words. Use journalistic tone.

title.description: Section 1 heading. Introduce main concept. Example: 'Understanding Bunions: More Than Just a Cosmetic Issue' or 'The Hidden Danger of Ignoring Bunion Pain'. 40-100 characters.

body.description: Section 1 body. Educational content about the problem/condition. Should be factual and informative. 200-500 words.

image.description: URL to section 1 image. Should illustrate concept (e.g., diagram of bunion, foot anatomy). Recommended 600x400px.

imageAlt.description: Alt text for section 1 image. Descriptive for accessibility. 40-150 characters.

section2.description: Second section (title appears in feature list and as heading)

title.description: Section 2 title. This appears both in bullet list AND as section heading. Example: 'Non-Surgical Correction Possible' or 'Clinically Tested Design'. Keep concise. 30-80 characters.

body.description: Section 2 body content. Expands on the title. 150-400 words.

title.description: Section 3 title. Appears in feature list AND as heading. 30-80 characters.

body.description: Section 3 body. Template has video placeholder. Content should reference demonstration or how-to. 150-400 words.

title.description: Section 4 title. Feature list + heading. 30-80 characters.

body.description: Section 4 body. 150-400 words. Note: Used TWICE in template (lines 1243 and 1264).

title.description: Section 5 title. Should introduce problem with alternatives. Example: 'Why Traditional Solutions Fall Short' or 'The Problem With Surgery, Pills, and Toe Spacers'. 30-100 characters.

body.description: Section 5 body. Explain why other solutions fail. Addresses objections. Has visual 'fails grid' with 4 items (Pills, Toe Spacers, Wide Shoes, Surgery - hardcoded in template). 200-500 words.

title.description: Section 6 title. Introduce the solution. Example: 'A New Approach That Actually Works' or 'The Simple Device Podiatrists Are Recommending'. 30-100 characters.

body.description: Section 6 body. Introduce product/solution. Start building interest. 200-400 words.

title.description: Section 7 heading. Continue selling. Example: 'How It Works: The Science Behind [Product]' or 'Designed By Podiatrists For Real Results'. 30-100 characters.

body.description: Section 7 body. Explain mechanism, features, benefits. 200-400 words.

image.description: URL to section 7 image. Product image or demo. Recommended 600x400px.

title.description: Section 8 heading (H3, subsection). Example: 'See It In Action' or 'Real Customer Demonstration'. 20-80 characters.

body.description: Section 8 body. Note: Used TWICE in template (before and after video placeholder). Keep it about demonstration/proof. 150-300 words.

title.description: Section 10 heading. Should introduce social proof. Example: 'Thousands Are Already Seeing Results' or 'Verified Customer Success Stories'. 30-100 characters.

body.description: Section 10 body. Build credibility through social proof. 150-300 words.

imageAlt.description: Alt text for section 10 image placeholder.

title.description: Section 11 heading. Focus on results. Example: 'The Results Speak For Themselves' or 'Before and After: Real Transformations'. 30-100 characters.

body.description: Section 11 body. Present results and proof. Has before/after image placeholder in template. 150-300 words.

title.description: Section 12 heading. Should introduce guarantee. Example: '90-Day Money-Back Guarantee' or 'Risk-Free Trial - Our Promise To You'. 30-100 characters.

body.description: Section 12 body. Explain guarantee and remove risk. Has guarantee image and CTA. 150-300 words.

primary.description: Primary CTA text. Strong action. Example: 'Try [Product] Risk-Free' or 'Get My [Product] Now - Limited Stock'. 20-60 characters.

secondary.description: Secondary CTA text (appears after guarantee section). Can be same or different from primary. Example: 'Claim Your Discount Now' or 'Order Today'. 20-60 characters.

reactions.description: Facebook-style comments section (appears in review cards AND comments section)

title.description: Comments section title. Example: 'What Customers Are Saying' or '3,791 Reviews'. Social proof focused.

r1.description: First review (appears as review card title AND in comments)

name.description: Review title OR commenter name. Used in multiple contexts. Can be benefit-focused review title like 'Life-Changing Results!' or person name. 10-80 characters.

text.description: Review/comment text. Detailed customer experience. Should sound authentic. 100-300 words.

time.description: Time posted. Example: '51 min' or '2 hours ago'.

blurb.description: Guarantee/assurance text. Removes final objections. Example: 'Every order is backed by our 90-day money-back guarantee. If you're not completely satisfied, simply return it for a full refund - no questions asked.' 100-300 words.

cta.description: Sticky CTA text. Very short for mobile. Example: 'Order Now' or 'Get Yours'. 10-40 characters.

copyright.description: Copyright text. Example: 'Â© 2025 [Brand]. All Rights Reserved.' Standard format.

disclaimer.description: Legal disclaimer. FDA compliance, results disclaimer, etc. 150-500 words. Example: 'Individual results may vary. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease...'
